intro: Wahlenbergia tysonii, commonly known as the Bluebell of the Southern Alps, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is known for its ornamental value. Wahlenbergia tysonii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
